summary: The document is a memorandum dated 22 July 1998, from J. Barry Harrelson, the JFK Project Officer, detailing the outcomes of the ARRB meeting on 20 July concerning the JFK assassination records. It outlines the ARRB's decisions on the protection and release of specific CIA documents, including actions on crypts/project names, the 'Mark Lane' document, and the JMWAVE org chart. The memorandum also notes the scheduling of the next Board meeting and emphasizes the need for prompt action on any appeals or reconsiderations.
key_findings: The ARRB accepted CIA requests regarding certain crypts/project names and the sanitization of an Australian document.
The ARRB rejected CIA requests to protect the digraph of crypt 'JDECANTER' and to deny in full the JMWAVE org chart, voting to open it in full.
Decisions were made on the inclusion of specific pages from the 'Mark Lane' document in the JFK collection.
The next Board meeting was scheduled for 6 August, with a call for prompt action on potential appeals or reconsiderations.
